author: mosseri
caption: A few thoughts on why creators will continue to matter, how aesthetics are changing, and no longer believing what we see in a world of infinite synthetic content as we head into 2026.

comments.message: How about let‚Äôs all consume original handpainted art in 2026?‚ù§Ô∏èü´∂üèºü•Çü•Ç
I'm here to stay as an illustrator and animator! ‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ú® No Ai ü§ñ ü´ß in 2026.

Thanks for describing in such exquisite detail why Instagram is not enjoyable for anyone anymore. The joy and spontaneity is gone.  Haven‚Äôt we all been saying this for a very long time? Instagram pretends to hear us, yet things continue to get worse.
I love the sentence: ‚Äúcan you make something that only you can create ?‚Äù
Happy new year 2o26 üëèüôå

I‚Äôll say what I‚Äôve been telling my clients‚Ä¶In 2026, ‚Äúauthentic content‚Äù isn‚Äôt about oversharing beyond what you‚Äôre comfortable with. It‚Äôs about creating what isn‚Äôt already everywhere. AI can write captions and create content but what it can‚Äôt do is live your life or have your unique experiences. THAT‚Äôs the advantage now. We have got to go back to basics and share our lived experiences and opinions and perspectives and be 1000% authentic. And the successful creators out there aren‚Äôt wondering what to post‚Ä¶they‚Äôre living their life and creating content around it. They‚Äôre sharing their thoughts, opinions, journeys, etc. So if content feels forced, that‚Äôs a sign to regroup ‚ù§Ô∏è
A great way to end the year and to finally be convinced that IG should be de-prioritized for me in 2026.

People stopped sharing so many personal moments because y‚Äôall keep changing the app, we do even see content from friends anymore we follow so why would we post? Please do some ACTUAL research. The data is going to show what you want as you continue to change the platform in ways people do not want.

The algorithm here is what is making creating authentic content seem pointless. I bet if you let people out of Instagram algorithm jail, your platform would explode. What if YOU became synonymous with authenticity?

Yeah, this is exactly why people feel Instagram is slipping. You engineered an algorithm nobody asked for. We followed people because we wanted to see them, then you hid them. Now the feed is ads and the same idea repeated a thousand times because we paused for half a second on one video. Humans are not spreadsheets. You cannot fully predict curiosity, context, or mood. Bring back a chronological feed by default, or at least give it its own tab. Let the algorithm live somewhere optional. Charge advertisers whatever you want, that is your business. Hell, charge users who want pure chronological, some of us would pay just to have our feeds work again. But the current setup is hurting creators, hurting businesses, and exhausting users. Three years of declining engagement did not come out of nowhere. This platform used to feel alive. Right now it feels engineered, noisy, and disconnected from how people actually use it.
Being real and human is more important than ever... build connections. AI can't do that.

If the cat is really out of the bag the way people are saying it is, you have the opportunity to be a leader in maintaining human-first advocacy in a world of distrust and disbelief. I genuinely hope the platform can evolve to the occasion as someone who has used it daily since 2011
Yet reach on authentic content has been drastically reduced in recent months here and in comparison to other platforms.

THIS. üëèüëèüëèAbsolutely here for original, raw, human content over overly-polished AI any day.Loved this reminder, Adam, that Instagram is about humanising content‚Ä¶real voices, real stories, real experiences. That‚Äôs what truly connects. That‚Äôs what builds trust.Create more. Edit less.Be human, that‚Äôs the real algorithm.üôÇ
@mosseri Awesome... can we stop censoring cannabis content and education yet?? üòÅ

You run a platform that actively encourages AI, to deny that is nonsense. You have an algorithm that has destroyed connection and is designed to maximise views that help your bottom line not one that encourages the best content and a genuinely social space
I deeply concerned about AI content. I am seeing hundreds of AI doctors indistinguishable from real humans recommending all sorts of alarming remedies. We need legislation, yesterday.

Adam, I‚Äôve read your post carefully and there‚Äôs a lot in it that shows real thought about where things need to go. But I think it misses a crucial moment of leadership.You talk about the need to change, about trust, about authenticity, and you point to factors like camera technology, culture and AI too, as forces that shaped where we are. All of that may be true, but what‚Äôs missing is clear ownership of Instagram‚Äôs role in this and where we are today. For years, this platform has rewarded polish, performance and constant optimisation. Creators learned very quickly what rose and what disappeared, and adjusted their work accordingly. Over time, that pulled both creators and audiences away from authenticity and real human connection.This year‚Äôs algorithm changes have gone much further than a shift in reach. They have directly affected people‚Äôs livelihoods. Established businesses have seen income drop, work dry up and years of audience-building undermined almost overnight. This is not theoretical or short-term. For many, the impact is ongoing and deeply destabilising.There is also no acknowledgement in your post that AI was pushed into the platform by default, with unclear consent and vague settings. Many people didn‚Äôt knowingly opt in, and that has damaged trust in a very real way.This felt like a moment to simply say: Instagram has been a big part of the problem, and we understand why people feel disconnected and frustrated and we‚Äôre really sorry. Without that honesty, calls for authenticity risk sounding hollow. Trust isn‚Äôt rebuilt with tools or 20 image long explanations. It‚Äôs rebuilt when responsibility is owned plainly and publicly and gigantic entities like this one have the balls to apologise ‚úåüèº
People are going to get exhausted by this and leave social media. Then it'll just be AI making content for AI. Happy New Year! ü•Ç

I have been saying this all year to the small business owners I work with. We can no longer be afraid of showing ourselves or sharing imperfect moments, because those are the things that matter more than ever. AI can make perfect images or videos but it‚Äôs can‚Äôt replicate your personal story or journey and that‚Äôs what people are interested in. ‚ù§Ô∏è I‚Äôm honestly scared where AI is heading and I wish platforms like Instagram would do more than just ‚Äòlabel it‚Äô but this is where the world is heading. In 2026 it‚Äôs time to show up as YOU, be a real human and boldly share your own story because that always cuts through the noise in a way AI just can‚Äôt!

I don‚Äôt agree on the part about making my photos look crappy, because they are too well captured.  I am a professional photographer, I will not chase trends. I will stay true to the crafty regardless of ai trying to copy me.  Don‚Äôt play to the lowest common denominator. Because in time, ai will start to copy the low quality astetic as well.
Please prioritize real content made by real creators. Terrifying things happening regarding Spotify self uploading to dilute their payout to artists.
We just want to see the content from the creators we chose to follow. And we want our content to be seen by people who chose to follow us. Bring that back!!
You‚Äôre not serious with this nonsense?

Interesting to have a thought piece about the evolution of the platform- however you are the platform. Why do you approach it like ‚Äúus‚Äù? You are not one of the users, you control the levers. Instagram chose to follow and borrow every other trend and manner of monetization rather than dig into why all those users signed up in the first place. The personal connections that drew hundreds of millions of users together were actively torn down by ‚Äúyou‚Äù. If you see challenges with AI and authenticity in the crystal ball, why not pivot away from AI and AI content? Your human users (the only ones that matter) might reward you for it.

Dear Instagram @mosseri We need a serious talk about giving creators a vacation and the algorithm not being affected. This is the only job in life where you get punished for taking time off. We creators are exhausted. This truly needs to be addressed with your team. We need a 3 week break minimum where if we don‚Äôt post we don‚Äôt get punished. Please please consider this.
In person events. Lived experiences. get outside and touch grass. Share about that.

The real issue is that you took the social out of social media. It used to be fun. Even the most mature people were on there laughing, using funny face filters, and not taking themselves so seriously. It was a place to be free from the weight of the world. A little escape. Now it feels like work. Everything is about performance, metrics, and hooks. Instead of showing up, we are strategizing. Instead of connecting, we are concentrating. The space that once felt light now carries the same pressure we were trying to escape. And the worst part is, even when we show up, our followers don‚Äôt even see our content anymore.
What about having a new kind of verification, something like the blue check, but a check that represents authenticity?

Every time you do a big explanation post like this, the comments are overwhelmingly negative, and everyone is saying the same thing. These are the things everyone wants: for their content to actually get shown to their followers, chronological feed, and to stop rearranging the app every 5 seconds (you try to disguise it as more user friendly, when in fact it‚Äôs just annoying). That‚Äôs it. Those have been the cries in the comments for YEARS. As a small business owner (who is struggling on this app b/c of all this) when my customers ask for a product repeatedly ‚Äî I give it to them! THEY are the ones who keep me in business. Just like without US you have no platform. Just like you want us to create content only WE can, we want you to be the platform only YOU can, instead of trying to ‚Äúkeep up‚Äù with every other social media app.
Congratulations on a 20 picture slide gaslighting the world on how you failed as a platform to protect creators. Cheers to 2026

Please fix Instagram‚Äôs AI enforcement and moderation. Too many accounts are being incorrectly restricted or having content removed due to false AI flags. Also, Meta Verified support needs a serious overhaul. Paying members should receive real, human support, not generic copy-paste responses that don‚Äôt address the issue. Hope this feedback helps, thanks üôè

Dear @mosseri - while you keep publicly pontificating and trying to make yourself sound smart and interesting, I‚Äôm gonna keep working for a world that protects all our kids, including yours - since you and @zuck have shown over and over again that what matters most to you is not human flourishing, not child well-being, not thriving communities or democracy but‚Ä¶ your bank accounts. No matter how much ‚Äúinnovation‚Äù you create, or how many fun things IG can do, or how much money $ you make for shareholders, nothing can or will ever erase the literal national emergency in child and adolescent mental health, the oceans of depressed, suicidal, self-harming, anxious, cutting, eating-disordered children you and your product helped create ‚Äî not to mention declining attention spans, reduction in literacy and destabilization of democracy. As sad as I am for families whose children died because of social media harms, I am also sad for your children who will someday learn how multiple members of your staff tried to get you and @zuck to reduce the harm, and you both replied by saying ‚Ä¶ ‚Äúmeh.‚Äù My wish for you for 2026 is that you become the father your sons need and learn to lead in a way that improves and doesn‚Äôt harm our collective well-being. History has its eyes on you. Yours truly, Julie, founder of @_wearemama.

This is so disingenuous. And quite remarkable coming from the CEO of a company that has pushed Al down our throats for the past 2 years then makes no meaningful attempt to protect creators. It's complete gaslighting. Remember that you built the fire, bought the matches, and doused the flames of Al because you needed to normalise Al ads, because it's all about revenue. You're constantly fiddling with the algorithm to make planning and posts completely unpredictable, so that people are chained to experimenting and messing up their own audience. An audience that they can barely interact with after developing communities for years. This post has a "deal with it" arrogance. I hope it gets the backlash it deserves.üò§

Practical ‚Äúauthenticity‚Äù: reducing the time between idea and execution.Less time editing, scripting, refining, polishing, and perfecting. The shorter the time between ‚ÄúI have an idea of what I want to post‚Äù and the actual post being posted, the more genuine and authentic it will be. üî•

Sorry, but as long as people who post ass and boobs get more reach than those who post real content‚ÄîAI or not‚Äîit‚Äôs hard to believe your words. The algorithm is unfair and rewards likes to boost distribution. But anyway‚Ä¶ hope never dies, right? Happy 2026 ü•Ç
The first social network to ban AI content will win in 2026.
All other platforms pay. Content creators,  Not Instagram though. üò§
This is exactly why streaming became super popular btw, because you can‚Äôt fake it.
Yes I believe in authentic creativity this is skills, imagination, reality facts about creators real staff real you.
Authenticity always wins

@mosseri those of us who have been here a long time building our followings have earned that trust through the things AI can‚Äôt replicate; human connection, shared experience and real life storytelling. Instagram showing our content to those people who have already certified our authenticity would surely a sensible strategy? ü§®

Entertainment algorithms have made it really hard for scientists. We can no longer prevent the spread of misinformation. It‚Äôs a sad world when a charlatan or AI makes a bold pseudoscientific claim and it goes viral, but the top scientist in the field corrects it and gets no views. I hope IG also addresses this harsh reality that is a necessary consequence of entertainment algorithms. Fake news, lies, and pseudoscience are far more entertaining than real news, truth, and actual science.
AI generated text üòÇ
This was def written by Ai , how ironic

The fact that these words are being spoken by Adam, of all people.The very person who built a cheap TikTok knockoff,used immature AI to devalue creators,and has been actively destroying genuine human connection‚Äîcoming from him, it‚Äôs completely beyond saving.2026 should be the year you are removed.

it‚Äôs a shame that you‚Äôve made Instagram feeds look like a high of advertising billboards and made it boring to scroll personal feeds, boring peple with constant ads. Same happened to Facebook. I don‚Äôt share as much on my personal account because my friends don‚Äôt see my post or don‚Äôt see them for weeks. You‚Äôve fed into the monster created by tiktok of ADD addiction that is doom-scrolling, where anything longer than 10 seconds became boring. you‚Äôre interested in following the money and dive into AI creativity, instead of supporting photographers, painters, artist exhibiting their art through photos, just because it‚Äôs easy for you and doom scrolling must be selling lots of ads. Too bad.
it would be cool if there was an ad rev change where ig paid creators

No offence but does this feel like it‚Äôs written by AI ü§ñ not that there‚Äôs anything wrong with that - I use chatGPT & Claude to write my content - but some tell tale signs of AI-ish on the writing are __ long hyphens .. and words like ‚Äúin a world‚Äù .. üòè
People don't share to their feed because you removed the ability for people to easily and regularly see the photos of the people they follow
I will never create anything AI
I think the ironic part about all this‚Ä¶ This entire post was written by CHATGPT. lol
Pretty much dead for photography now.

So here‚Äôs an idea: what if there was a strict no AI policy, an algorithm that shows the real people we can trust and have chosen to follow, and a way for authentic content creators to be paid  for the near constant uploads this platform asks for. Seems in line with the values you‚Äôre saying instagram has, I think. And since instagram is extremely powerful at being able to push its users in the direction you value, this seems like the very best solution to keeping authentic content king and AI slop out. So what are the chances we get to see any of that?

Imagine it the solution to keeping people on feed was as simple as showing them the creators they followed FIRST before ads, before suggesting new content‚Ä¶. ü§îLike when Instagram was in it‚Äôs golden era‚Ä¶ man those were the days. üò¢
ok then DO SOMETHING ABOUT IT!!! oh my godddd

Hi @mosseri , your post mentions verifying authenticity and improving enforcement signals. Our decade old community platform @darkskinwomen (1.7M) was permanently disabled on Nov 30, 2025 after what looks like an automated copyright escalation tied to older posts shared in good faith, where rights changed years later. The appeal path was non functional and froze on ‚ÄòYou submitted an appeal on Nov 30‚Äô, with no way to add evidence. We also received a DMCA notice at ~05:23 and the account action followed at ~05:35, so there was no meaningful chance to respond. Can your team route this to the enforcement/IP team for manual review and restore access if the ‚Äòrepeat infringer‚Äô classification is incorrect. This platform served millions of Black women and documented the impact of colorism, and losing it this way is devastating.

Definitely not interested in Instagram catching up. I think what would keep the platform inviting is the option to filter out ai content. I personally want none of it as a film photographer interested in viewing real moments in time that actually happenedüñ§

@zuck @mosseri Every time Adam posts something,I‚Äôm taken aback ‚Äî and not in a good way.Whenever he opens his mouth,the comments are filled with criticism.This isn‚Äôt coincidence, and it isn‚Äôt noise.It‚Äôs the result of years of running a platformthat ignores users‚Äô voicesand doesn‚Äôt even deliver posts to their own followers.Is there any other platform leaderwho has lost this much public trust?Honestly, even if Putin were to post,‚ÄúI hope for peace in Ukraine,‚ÄùI don‚Äôt think it would receive reactions this bad.

I feel like content within the Jewish space on Instagram has only had mass engagement in times of tragedy. Jewish joy and simply existing as a Jew online outside of tearful testimonies and trauma is not being amplified, and I‚Äôm hoping to see a change in that.
I just want a burger to eat
There is no ‚Äúamazing AI content.‚Äù

"In a world of infinite abundance and infinite doubt, the creators who can maintain trust and signal authenticity - by being real, transparent and consistent - will stand out." üóøReally ... ? ü§î In 2025, you completely destroyed my reach, and the community I spent almost 10 years to build by being "real".I'm now totally invisible, with only 2% of my followers seeing my new posts.And I'm not the only one in this situation, there's countless creators who are facing even worse.I don't know why you guys all refuse to acknowledge this, we did everything right, meanwhile everything turned wrong for absolutely no reason.And when we report this, it's never taken seriously, always interpreted as "complaining" or "lame guy against evolution" ... It's not the case !We want the best too for Instagram ! But not by destroying everything we built here !A platform without users is nothing, we are the core of all of this, please NEVER forget it.
Creators are unfortunately being abandonned for the funny Reels. Creation is not always funny.
An act of rebellion would be to go back to chronological feeds. Less opportunity for AI to have influence when the person scrolling is actively seeing the people they follow.

Instagram will be just fine IF you manage to reward us creators for once instead of pushing those tha made you what you are down. That‚Äôs not monetization i allude to, but reach. Reach to those that want to see real people creating real art (or content if you wanna call it like that). Happy New Year @mosseri

The other thing I see happening is a shift into who can copy an idea and who is creating real thoughts and ideas. It is easy to grow an account on recycled content but harder to keep an audience without original ideas and experience.

Very well articulated. I have this theory, that just like we envy older generations for having access to cheap real estate in the US, we‚Äôve had a similar opportunity to be able to build our voices online before the infinite content machine arrived. It‚Äôll become much harder as the years progress due to the built in skepticism you mention. The who is saying something, not the what, is definitely the game now.  And slide #6 is my favorite

I dunno if the IG team is being genuinely oblivious or intentionally manipulative. The whole idea of regular feed dying was a result of the changes to the algorithm. It wasn't bcos people stopped engaging it's bcos you guys stopped showing it to followers. You deliberately manipulate behavior by reckless design choices and algorithmic changes then come out here publicly to say that "the data says that the normal IG feed is dead, people don't use it." It's gone beyond data collection, it's data manipulation at this stage. False positives to create the narrative that you want to promote. Hey, we want more authentic content. Proceeds to manipulate the algorithm to only promote low-quality blog videos and kill high-production videos, animations and art content. You manipulate the algorithm to promote meme content, later you complain there are too many curator pages. Complaining on IG is beating a dead horse. It's clear your goals no longer align with needs of users. Do what you want, but don't come on public record to try gaslighting the public that you're making design changes bcos the data shows "X" when in reality, the data shows that bcos you manipulated the algorithm and design of the software to promote that exact behavior. Have a good year.

Since you dropped the users ability to see their friends posts through chronological feed and feed is all about creators what‚Äôs the point for users to stay on this platform? All millennials joined because they wanted to see what they are friends are posting. Photos were telling nice stories and you could see beautiful places. Same happened to Facebook before and it‚Äôs a pity what you have created. People prefer to touch grass rather than spending time on social media anymore. People stopped posting because they don‚Äôt find point anymore to contribute to this monster.
You ruined a once great platform. You hide posts from ppl we follow and let AI decide what to show ppl. How about just showing ppl who they follow? It ain‚Äôt hard.
I enjoy making homemade posts like a homemade card, no canva, no apps, just me using the good ole fashion way. ‚ô•Ô∏è

Who knew taking away the chronological feed, showing us stuff we didn't want, and filling our feed with ads would have a negative effect.  I've seen IG slowly dying these past two years.  And it's only accelerating.
go back to chronological order of seeing your friends post photos. you're not tiktok

Happy freakin new yearüòÑü§çshow the content of the people we follow and show our content to the people that chose to follow us and leaning on people sharing and communicating like a community of social media
If only instagram would actually listen to its users, you wouldn‚Äôt have these ‚Äúthoughts‚Äù and you‚Äôd still be thriving.

You've started from a false premise: "People don't want to share personal moments on feed anymore." Simply because you've seen an uptick of people using DMs the way we used to use the feed. That behaviour arose because you destroyed the effectiveness of sharing to feed. But if you were paying attention and actually cared you would have seen that people LOVE sharing personal moments to feed. Did you miss the millions of end of year recap carousels or "dumps" as people like to call them??? Stop fiddling. Start listening. Instagram didn't get successful trying to guess what people might want and shape shifting to be that. It was popular for the same reasons you say content here is: Instagram was authentically itself. I wish you would have had the confidence of your convictions when you tried to launch a standalone video platform Lasso...but you rolled it into this app because it was dying a death. If you were right, Lasso would have worked. Instead, you had to leverage the existing success that Instagram already built. You're too sure about the wrong things and you don't listen or pay attention nearly enough. It's a shame.
This was scary but helpful

I unfollow pages that use AI. Im not interested. Everything I do on this page is about sharing authenticity. I reached 30m people in the last 90 days and I only have 96k followers. I think that says something. People want information. They want authenticity. They want real information. There is a market for AI and people that want the fantasy. I will never be that guy nor will I ever share that

Get rid of ADS. I do not want to see sponsored posts or stuff I don‚Äôt follow 10x more than post from people I do follow. Bring back chrono order. Heck, go back to IG 2018 and then never add anything again. And all the censorship and shadow banning - get rid of it. Let us see what we want to see. Regulations of certain things are completely based on opinion here and not law.

‚ÄúPeople stopped sharing personal moments to feed years ago‚Äù was literally just having this conversation with my partner last night and you want to know the actual reason why? Every 2 posts on her ‚Äúfeed‚Äù is an ad. It‚Äôs impossible to enjoy so she goes to story and reels where there aren‚Äôt any ads. To say the data shows people prefer these feeds is correct but it‚Äôs also engineered and cherry picked because you‚Äôve made the main reason people want to use the app impossible to enjoy. It‚Äôs like saying people prefer bike lanes but omitting it‚Äôs because cars are encouraged to run people down in the street ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è true but only true by omission.
What a timeline
in feed still movin, check those 2025 dumps today üòÇ
Perfectly imperfect and uniquely YOURS. I can get behind that üôå

Mr @mosseri all due respect. But what i just read is frustrating üòí to me.  I'm speaking for myself.  I understand about the fast growing pace. Totally get it.  But you guys are still focusing on AI and influencer's.  So is this your subliminal way of getting rid of small authentic businesses like mine? Are you guys getting ready to build a program that will mute small businesses that are not "INFLUENCER'S" because that's what I'm interpreting from these 20 pages of explanation.  Because to me it sounds like you're going to come up with a way to flag AI and flag simple businesses that are not up to AI standard which will cancel accounts because they are not withing the guidelines of being an influencer.  That's what I'm reading.  If that's the case I might as well delete my account NOW!
@imperfects

It‚Äôs disappointing to hear this, the aesthetic from 2015 is real photography, and yes AI has its uses but the fact that a person who spends 20 years perfecting their craft to be copied by anyone with generative AI(ripping off their style) is not something to glorify‚Ä¶
Agree with the sentiment but the sheer number of em dashes screams AI to me.

Start by taking care of your creators putting out original content every day for minimal growth. Views/follows/engagement is tanking from the algorithm updates. It forces your creators to platforms that support growth

Yall just want to continue to morph into the most popular or trendy social media apps instead of staying true to what made Instagram different... we see more content from accounts we dont follow or care to follow instead of people we want too... the app is a sh!t show and it gets worse by the week

Yo ngl but Adam just put words to what a lot of us feel but haven‚Äôt been able to frame yet. When AI makes perfection cheap and everywhere, the real flex ain‚Äôt polish, it‚Äôs provenance, context, personal character. Not just what you post, but who you are when you post it and why. Raw isn‚Äôt a trend, it‚Äôs now becoming a trust signal. Them blurry pic, the shaky video, the unpolished moment he talking bout‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs proof of presence in a world drowning in simulations. We‚Äôre not regressing, we‚Äôre going deeper. In this era of all the bullshit, identity isn‚Äôt how clean your output looks‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs how hard you are to replicate. Stay true to self.

Tricky and fascinating the AI revolution. I‚Äôm lucky to have lived before the internet and now I get to live through all these new worlds/times. A garden and hands in the earth keeps it all real ü™¥ü™è
This is scary lol

I hope that in 2026 Instagram realigns with its creators. Right now, the algorithm feels confusing and discouraging. Artistic content, especially music, struggles to reach audiences, while superficial content is widely pushed. For many of us who have built communities here for years, this makes the platform harder to trust as a creative workspace.‚ù§Ô∏è

I welcome the filtration that Ai will eventually force. Prior to the generative AI explosion, we had already reached a singularity of content (i hate that word), over saturation, clones of clones. It was increasingly difficult to tell creators work apart from each other. Ai is hyper accelerating that saturation and is forcing us to adapt and elevate our deductive and curatorial abilities as well as elevate our place as creators and essentially ‚Äúbrands‚Äù (for better or worse). Ai will dominate the saturated ‚Äúcontent‚Äù layer and true creators and artists will stand the test of time as they always have. Everything is a cycle and real, good human creation will be more and more valuable while Ai fills the gaps‚Ä¶And quite simply, Ai is not going anywhere. So creators, whether you augment your abilities with Ai, or create an untouchable lane of pure human creation, it‚Äôs time to stop complaining, step up and adapt, . I personally have always hated being labeled a ‚Äúcontent creator‚Äù by brands that didn‚Äôt know better. I‚Äôll leave that content junk to Ai. Brands, Organizations, and collectors, if you want real creation, real, good, human work‚Ä¶the price just went up.
This is so deeply obnoxious.

This one hits hard. As a photographer, so much of what we create comes from time, experience, and the way we see the world ‚Äî not just the final image. Watching AI explode has brought a layer of skepticism that never used to exist. I hope we find ways to protect the craft and make sure the people putting in the work still get seen.

I find this amusing. Because unless you fit a predetermined niche you are not supported. My authentic me is varied. I do entertainment interviews with thought provoking answers from a- listers. But I also cover fashion. I‚Äôm an author. I go to Michelin star restaurants and share if they are good or suck. I don‚Äôt fit a category. So the algorithm doesn‚Äôt know what to do with me. The drive to connect fb and ig and reward those who do means content is replicated for different target audiences. Individuality is not rewarded. Blending into the mass is. That said. Ig is my favorite way to communicate w my followers. Too bad it focuses on depressing shares to followers and rewards new. It would be great if there was more of a balance. I have refused to become one thing to get numbers. I am as authentic as it gets. If that‚Äôs what you are looking for - come find me. Reward me. Said with the best intentions
Not Instagram pushing AI powered tools into every feature only to complain about AI getting too good
WELL SAID. ‚ÄúIn a world of infinite abundance and infinite doubt, the creators who can maintain trust and signal authenticity-by being real, transparent, and consistent-will stand out.‚Äù
